One Level Up Top Level

ocaml/stdlib/Makefile - ocaml

  1. #**************************************************************************
  2. #*                                                                        *
  3. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  4. #*                                                                        *
  5. #*            Xavier Leroy, projet Cristal, INRIA Rocquencourt            *
  6. #*                                                                        *
  7. #*   Copyright 1999 Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et     *
  8. #*     en Automatique.                                                    *
  9. #*                                                                        *

  11. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  12. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  13. #*                                                                        *
  14. #**************************************************************************

  16. ROOTDIR = ..
  17. # NOTE: it is important that the OCAMLDEP variable is defined *before*
  18. # Makefile.common gets included, so that its local definition here
  19. # take precedence over its general shared definitions in Makefile.common.
  20. OCAMLDEP ?= $(BOOT_OCAMLDEP)

  22. include $(ROOTDIR)/Makefile.common

  24. TARGET_BINDIR ?= $(BINDIR)

  26. COMPILER=$(ROOTDIR)/ocamlc$(EXE)
  27. CAMLC=$(OCAMLRUN) $(COMPILER)
  28. COMPFLAGS=-strict-sequence -absname -w +a-4-9-41-42-44-45-48 \
  29.           -g -warn-error +A -bin-annot -nostdlib -principal
  30. ifeq "$(FLAMBDA)" "true"
  31. OPTCOMPFLAGS += -O3
  32. endif
  33. OPTCOMPILER=$(ROOTDIR)/ocamlopt
  34. CAMLOPT=$(OCAMLRUN) $(OPTCOMPILER)

  36. include StdlibModules

  38. OBJS=$(addsuffix .cmo,$(STDLIB_MODULES))
  39. NOSTDLIB= camlinternalFormatBasics.cmo stdlib.cmo
  40. OTHERS=$(filter-out $(NOSTDLIB),$(OBJS))

  42. .PHONY: all
  43. all: stdlib.cma std_exit.cmo camlheader target_camlheader camlheader_ur

  45. ifeq "$(RUNTIMED)" "true"
  46. all: camlheaderd target_camlheaderd
  47. endif

  49. ifeq "$(INSTRUMENTED_RUNTIME)" "true"
  50. all: camlheaderi target_camlheaderi
  51. endif

  53. .PHONY: allopt opt.opt # allopt and opt.opt are synonyms
  54. allopt: stdlib.cmxa std_exit.cmx
  55. opt.opt: allopt

  57. INSTALL_STDLIB_META_DIR=$(DESTDIR)$(LIBDIR)/stdlib

  59. .PHONY: install
  60. install::
  61.         $(INSTALL_DATA) \
  62.           stdlib.cma std_exit.cmo *.cmi camlheader_ur \
  63.           "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)"
  64.         $(MKDIR) "$(INSTALL_STDLIB_META_DIR)"
  65.         $(INSTALL_DATA) META "$(INSTALL_STDLIB_META_DIR)"
  66. ifeq "$(INSTALL_SOURCE_ARTIFACTS)" "true"
  67.         $(INSTALL_DATA) \
  68.           *.cmt *.cmti *.mli *.ml *.ml.in \
  69.           "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)"
  70. endif
  71.         $(INSTALL_DATA) target_camlheader "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)/camlheader"

  73. ifeq "$(RUNTIMED)" "true"
  74. install::
  75.         $(INSTALL_DATA) target_camlheaderd "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)/camlheaderd"
  76. endif

  78. ifeq "$(INSTRUMENTED_RUNTIME)" "true"
  79. install::
  80.         $(INSTALL_DATA) target_camlheaderi "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)/camlheaderi"
  81. endif

  83. .PHONY: installopt
  84. installopt: installopt-default

  86. .PHONY: installopt-default
  87. installopt-default:
  88.         $(INSTALL_DATA) \
  89.           stdlib.cmxa stdlib.$(A) std_exit.$(O) *.cmx \
  90.           "$(INSTALL_LIBDIR)"

  92. ifeq "$(UNIX_OR_WIN32)" "unix"
  93. HEADERPROGRAM = header
  94. HEADER_PATH = $(BINDIR)/
  95. HEADER_TARGET_PATH = $(TARGET_BINDIR)/
  96. else # Windows
  97. HEADERPROGRAM = headernt
  98. HEADER_PATH =
  99. HEADER_TARGET_PATH =
  100. endif

  102. TARGETHEADERPROGRAM = target_$(HEADERPROGRAM)

  104. # The shebang test in configure.ac will need updating if any runtime is
  105. # introduced with a suffix more than one character long (camlheader_ur doesn't
  106. # matter).
  107. CAMLHEADERS =\
  108.   camlheader target_camlheader camlheader_ur \
  109.   camlheaderd target_camlheaderd \
  110.   camlheaderi target_camlheaderi

  112. # The % in pattern rules must always match something, hence the slightly strange
  113. # patterns and $(subst ...) since `camlheader%:` wouldn't match `camlheader`
  114. ifeq "$(SHEBANGSCRIPTS)" "true"
  115. camlhead%: $(ROOTDIR)/Makefile.config Makefile
  116. ifeq "$(LONG_SHEBANG)" "true"
  117.         $(V_GEN)echo '#!/bin/sh' > $@ && \
  118.         echo 'exec "$(BINDIR)/ocamlrun$(subst er,,$*)" "$$0" "$$@"' >> $@
  119. else
  120.         $(V_GEN)echo '#!$(BINDIR)/ocamlrun$(subst er,,$*)' > $@
  121. endif

  123. # TODO This does not take long shebangs into account (since TARGET_BINDIR is not
  124. #      yet processed by configure)
  125. target_%: $(ROOTDIR)/Makefile.config Makefile
  126.         $(V_GEN)echo '#!$(TARGET_BINDIR)/ocamlrun$(subst camlheader,,$*)' > $@

  128. camlheader_ur: Makefile
  129.         $(V_GEN)echo '#!' | tr -d '\012' > $@

  131. else # Hashbang scripts not supported

  133. $(CAMLHEADERS): $(HEADERPROGRAM).c $(ROOTDIR)/Makefile.config Makefile

  135. # $@.exe is deleted to ensure no Cygwin .exe mangling takes place
  136. camlhead%: tmphead%.exe
  137.         $(V_GEN)rm -f $@.exe && \
  138.         mv $< $@

  140. # Again, pattern weirdness here means that the dot is always present so that
  141. # tmpheader.exe matches.
  142. tmpheader%exe: $(HEADERPROGRAM)%$(O)
  143.         $(V_MKEXE)$(call MKEXE_VIA_CC,$@,$^)
  144. # FIXME This is wrong - mingw could invoke strip; MSVC equivalent?
  145. ifneq "$(UNIX_OR_WIN32)" "win32"
  146.         strip $@
  147. endif

  149. $(HEADERPROGRAM)%$(O): \
  150.   OC_CPPFLAGS += -DRUNTIME_NAME='"$(HEADER_PATH)ocamlrun$(subst .,,$*)"'

  152. $(HEADERPROGRAM)%$(O): $(HEADERPROGRAM).c
  153.         $(V_CC)$(CC) -c $(OC_CFLAGS) $(CFLAGS) $(OC_CPPFLAGS) $(CPPFLAGS) \
  154.           $(OUTPUTOBJ)$@ $^

  156. camlheader_ur: camlheader
  157.         $(V_GEN)cp camlheader $@

  159. ifeq "$(UNIX_OR_WIN32)" "unix"
  160. tmptargetcamlheader%exe: $(TARGETHEADERPROGRAM)%$(O)
  161.         $(V_MKEXE)$(call MKEXE_VIA_CC,$@,$^)
  162.         strip $@

  164. $(TARGETHEADERPROGRAM)%$(O): $(HEADERPROGRAM).c
  165.         $(V_CC)$(CC) -c $(OC_CFLAGS) $(CFLAGS) $(OC_CPPFLAGS) $(CPPFLAGS) \
  166.               -DRUNTIME_NAME='"$(HEADER_TARGET_PATH)ocamlrun$(subst .,,$*)"' \
  167.               $(OUTPUTOBJ)$@ $^

  169. target_%: tmptarget%.exe
  170.         $(V_GEN)rm -f $@.exe && \
  171.         mv $< $@
  172. else
  173. target_%: %
  174.         $(V_GEN)cp $< $@
  175. endif

  177. endif # ifeq "$(SHEBANGSCRIPTS)" "true"

  179. stdlib.cma: $(OBJS)
  180.         $(V_LINKC)$(CAMLC) -a -o $@ $^

  182. stdlib.cmxa: $(OBJS:.cmo=.cmx)
  183.         $(V_LINKOPT)$(CAMLOPT) -a -o $@ $^

  185. .PHONY: distclean
  186. distclean: clean
  187.         rm -f sys.ml META

  189. .PHONY: clean
  190. clean::
  191.         rm -f $(CAMLHEADERS)

  193. export AWK

  195. %.cmi: %.mli
  196.         $(V_OCAMLC)$(CAMLC) $(COMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) -c $<

  198. # The dependency on the .mli file is in .depend (since stdlib__Foo.cmi
  199. # depends on stdlib__foo.mli)
  200. stdlib__%.cmi:
  201.         $(V_OCAMLC)$(CAMLC) $(COMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) \
  202.                  -o $@ -c $(filter %.mli, $^)

  204. %.cmo: %.ml
  205.         $(V_OCAMLC)$(CAMLC) $(COMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) -c $<

  207. # The dependency on the .ml file is in .depend (since stdlib__Foo.cmo
  208. # depends on stdlib__foo.ml)
  209. stdlib__%.cmo:
  210.         $(V_OCAMLC)$(CAMLC) $(COMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) \
  211.                  -o $@ -c $(filter %.ml, $^)

  213. %.cmx: %.ml
  214.         $(V_OCAMLOPT)$(CAMLOPT) $(COMPFLAGS) $(OPTCOMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) -c $<

  216. # The dependency on the .ml file is in .depend (since stdlib__Foo.cmx
  217. # depends on stdlib__foo.ml)
  218. stdlib__%.cmx:
  219.         $(V_OCAMLOPT)$(CAMLOPT) $(COMPFLAGS) $(OPTCOMPFLAGS) $(shell ./Compflags $@) \
  220.                    -o $@ -c $(filter %.ml, $^)

  222. # Dependencies on the compiler
  223. COMPILER_DEPS=$(filter-out -use-prims $(OCAMLRUN), $(CAMLC))
  224. $(OBJS) std_exit.cmo: $(COMPILER_DEPS)
  225. $(OBJS:.cmo=.cmi) std_exit.cmi: $(COMPILER_DEPS)
  226. $(OBJS:.cmo=.cmx) std_exit.cmx: $(OPTCOMPILER)

  228. # Dependencies on Stdlib (not tracked by ocamlc -depend)

  230. $(OTHERS) std_exit.cmo: stdlib.cmi
  231. $(OTHERS:.cmo=.cmi) std_exit.cmi: stdlib.cmi
  232. $(OBJS:.cmo=.cmx) std_exit.cmx: stdlib.cmi
  233. $(OTHERS:.cmo=.cmx) std_exit.cmx: stdlib.cmx

  235. clean::
  236.         rm -f *.cm* *.o *.obj *.a *.lib *.odoc
  237.         rm -rf flexdll

  239. include .depend

  241. STDLIB_NAMESPACE_MODULES = $(subst $(SPACE),|,$(STDLIB_PREFIXED_MODULES))

  243. GNUISH_SED = \
  244.   $(if $(filter X,$(shell echo x | $(SED) -E -e 's/./\u&/' 2>/dev/null)),\
  245.        $(SED),$(error GNU sed is needed for make depend))

  247. .PHONY: depend
  248. depend:
  249.         $(V_OCAMLDEP){ \
  250.           $(OCAMLDEP_CMD) $(filter-out stdlib.%,$(wildcard *.mli *.ml)); \
  251.           $(OCAMLDEP_CMD) -pp "$(AWK) -f ./remove_module_aliases.awk" \
  252.           stdlib.ml stdlib.mli; \
  253.         } | \
  254.         $(GNUISH_SED) -E \
  255.         -e 's/^(${STDLIB_NAMESPACE_MODULES})(\.[^i]*)(i?) :/\1\2\3 : \1.ml\3/' \
  256.         -e 's#(^| )(${STDLIB_NAMESPACE_MODULES})[.]#\1stdlib__\u\2.#' \
  257.         > .$@

One Level Up Top Level
